case_circumstances: A workman at the Pan Western Yard smelled a foul odor emanating from a Union Pacific Railroad Car at the incident location. The car had been loaded with rebar in Houston, TX on 6/21/05 at 1500 hours and it had arrived at the Pan Western Yard 7/6/05 at about 1230 hours. The workman climbed up the side of the open top car and found the decedent unresponsive, crushed under the load of rebar.
case_head_hair: Possibly black or brown; up to 2" in length
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is available and entered
case_clothing_on_body: Long-sleeved purple sweat shirt, denim jean shorts (Paco Sport brand, size 30 waist), white boxer shorts, multicolored plaid boxer shorts, red bandana
case_footwear: One tan leather lace-up "Workman" left boot, size 8.5
dental: Dental information / charting is available and entered
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
